subject: Re: What's the best way to start learning Quikscript?
msgSnippet: Your message was held up until I saw it and let it through. Your account has been change and you no longer need moderation. If you want to just learn the
messageBody:
Your message was held up until I saw it and let it through. Your account has been change and you no longer need moderation.
   If you want to just learn the alphabet (a good place to start) there are flashcards available at Cram.com and elsewhere.
http://www.cram.com/flashcards/quikkscript-5304254
   This group has files with alphabet sheets, lots of discussions of how to fit the alphabet to one's own accent, and 'translated' texts to learn from. I particularly liked the Alice in Wonderland progressive reader. Only a few substitutions were made each chapter, making the text more and more like QS as you read on.

   And I'm sure you'll get lots more suggestions from the other fine members here. We're always glad to see a new 'face'!
